page.title: 14Farming Special (Part 2)
page.content: {Most}of the{farms}in our area are {well established.}They vary in size from 70acres to several hundred.Most of the{farmhouses}are quite{old}but a few have been built this century.Most are{stone built.}The{modern}ones from {brick.}One{old}one is{timber framed and is a{protected building.}Old farm buildings are either timber framed or stone.They always have wooden doors. Modern ones are iron girder frames with exterior cladding made from metal,plastic or asbestos sheets.Most farm gates are tubular metal. The {smaller farms}seem to have the{older, cheaper{tractors. Larger farms}have more{up to date}& expensive{tractors. The same can be said for other farm machinery.If it cannot be put into a barn,equipment is left outside in all weathers.The better farms try to keep theirs under cover and in good shape.
